item.name: Melville's Marvelous Map
item.text:
This appears to be a blank piece of parchment. As an action, you can use the command "Where the hell are we?!" The map then reveals the area outdoors in a 5-mile radius for 1 minute.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 21 (Homebrew)

item.name: Hammer of the North
item.text:
Deals 1d12 bludgeoning damage plus 2d4 cold damage. Can use an action to cast bright light for 30 ft.
Proficiency: martial, warhammer Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 21 (Homebrew)

item.name: Vithral Armor
item.text:
This magical, lightweight armor is made from adamantine and has an AC of 15.
Proficiency: light armor Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 49 (Homebrew)

item.name: Potion of Warmth
item.text:
For 1 hour after you drink this potion, you gain resistance to cold damage. In addition, you are unharmed by temperatures as low as −50 degrees Fahrenheit.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 50 (Homebrew)

item.name: Ice Mace
item.text:
Deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage plus 2d6 cold damage.
Proficiency: simple, mace Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 51 (Homebrew)

item.name: Greatsword of Hell
item.text:
Deals 2d6 slashing damage plus 4d4 cold damage. Can be magically summoned from anywhere.
Proficiency: martial, greatsword Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 52 (Homebrew)

item.name: Tent of Plenty
item.text:
This appears to be a two-person tent, inside it is a spacious log cabin with 10 beds. Each morning rations and full waterskins for 10 people appear in the cabin. It weighs one pound.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 66 (Homebrew)

item.name: True North Ring
item.text:
A copper ring with a stylized blue letter "N." While wearing the ring, you will feel a slight vibration if it's pointed due north.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 69 (Homebrew)

item.name: Pack of Plenty
item.text:
This weathered green backpack seems quite ordinary. However, it contains three two-person tents, six bedrolls, a rowboat, and a tinderbox. The magical pack weighs one pound, and only these items can be stored in the pack.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 72 (Homebrew)

item.name: Frog-Get-About-It Potion
item.text:
When you consume this cursed potion, you turn into a frog for 1d4 hours. A remove curse spell or similar magic will end this effect. It takes 1d20 minutes to remember who you were before you drank the potion. Your statistics remain the same, with the following exceptions:
• Your size becomes Tiny. • Your AC becomes 11 (natural armor). • Your hopping (er, walking) speed becomes 20 ft. • You gain a swimming speed of 20 ft.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 82 (Homebrew)

item.name: Rain Cloak
item.text:
This appears to be a simple blue cloak with a green hood. While you wear this cloak, you remain completely dry.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 89 (Homebrew)

item.name: The Sword of Power
item.text:
This +2 golden greatsword has runes lining its deadly blade. It does an extra 1d10 damage to fiends and undead. While wielding this sword, you can also cast the entangle spell (DC 16) three times a day.
Proficiency: martial, greatsword Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 98 (Homebrew)

item.name: Flute of Foraging
item.text:
When you play this dark brown wooden flute, golden notes come to life and float over any edible plants within 100 ft. You add +2 to any Wisdom (Survival) checks for foraging.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 102 (Homebrew)

item.name: Flaming Pumpkin
item.text:
Ammo: sling bullet
This item resembles an ordinary pumpkin, which you can activate with a magic word. Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 40/120 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage and 7 (2d6) fire damage.
Thrown: If a weapon has the Thrown property, you can throw the weapon to make a ranged attack. If the weapon is a melee weapon, you use the same ability modifier for that attack roll and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack with the weapon. For example, if you throw a handaxe, you use your Strength, but if you throw a dagger, you can use either your Strength or your Dexterity, since the dagger has the Finesse property.
Range: A weapon that can be used to make a ranged attack has a range shown in parentheses after the ammunition or thrown property. The range lists two numbers. The first is the weapon's normal range in feet, and the second indicates the weapon's maximum range. When attacking a target beyond normal range, you have disadvantage on the attack roll. You can't attack a target beyond the weapon's long range.
Proficiency: simple, sling Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 106 (Homebrew)

item.name: Travis' Treehouse
item.text:
A miniature treehouse on a tiny tree. You can use an action to speak a command word and a full-size wooden treehouse appears 20 ft. up the nearest tree. It is the size of a four-person tent and has a rope ladder. The command word can then be uttered to return the treehouse to its normal size if it's empty. The treehouse has an AC of 15 and 40 hit points.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 116 (Homebrew)

item.name: Bridge Deck
item.text:
It appears to be an ordinary set of playing cards. If four face cards are placed on one side of a river, a magical bridge appears for 10 minutes. It is 10 ft. wide and reaches the other side. The bridge cannot be damaged.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 124 (Homebrew)

item.name: Hawkeye Shield
item.text:
Appears to be a silver shield with a red hawk symbol. After speaking the command word, the hawk comes to life. It can be sent 200 ft. in any direction for 1 minute. The hawk's vision is shown on the shield. After 1 minute the hawk becomes a symbol again. The item can be activated twice a day.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 139 (Homebrew)
